definition.p: Let X,Y be topological spaces, generated respectively by the bases \mc B_X,\mc B_Y. Then the product space is given by the set X\times Y=\setBuilder{\tuple{x,y}}{x\in X,y\in Y} with the topology generated by the basis \mc B=\setBuilder{U\times V}{U\in\mc B_X,V\in\mc B_Y}.

theorem.p: The Euclidean space \mb R^{n+1} is homeomorphic to the product space \mb R^n\times\mb R.

proposition.p: The product X\times Y is Hausdorff if and only if X,Y are each Hausdorff.

theorem.p: The product X\times Y is regular if and only if X,Y are each regular.
Let S=\mb R equipped with the Sorgenfrey topology. Then S is normal, but S\times S is not normal.

proposition.p: Let p\in Y. The subspace \setBuilder{\tuple{x,p}}{x\in X} of X\times Y is homeomorphic to X.
The diagonal \Delta=\setBuilder{\tuple{x,x}}{x\in X} of X\times X is homeomorphic to X.
The product spaces X\times Y and Y\times X are homeomorphic.

definition.p: For a product space X\times Y, its projection maps \pi_X:X\times Y\to X and \pi_Y:X\times Y\to Y are defined by \pi_X(\tuple{x,y})=x and \pi_Y(\tuple{x,y})=y.

example.title: Properties of projection maps
example.p: Verify the following properties of projection maps.

ol.li: The projection of an open set is always open.
The projection of a closed set is not always closed.

theorem.p: The product X\times Y is metrizable if and only if X,Y are each metrizable.

lemma.p: Let Y be compact. If \mc U is an open cover of X\times Y, then for each x\in X there exists a finite subcollection \mc F_x\subseteq\mc U and an open neighborhood U_x of x such that U_x\times Y\subseteq\bigcup\mc F_x.

theorem.p: The product X\times Y is compact if and only if X,Y are each compact.
The product X\times Y is connected if and only if X,Y are each connected.
